text: my name's adam burns and I'm from
Newmarket Suffolk England there were
four friends and wanted to go to the
World Cup you also wanted to help the
people of Bahia and the charity that's
very close to our hearts the Jade of the
Arts care trust so we set out toward
1966 kilometres from Mendoza and
Argentina to Porto Alegre Brazil the
last time england won the World Cup was
nineteen sixty 60 it's a very iconic
number for England fans part of me
didn't really know what to expect it was
my first time in South America the
reality was that it was really really
grueling we walked three days through
the San Luis desert in Argentina 35
degree heat no shade the biggest
mosquitoes I've ever seen and we had to
sleep in abandoned train stations we
were charged by bulls on two separate
occasions we went over the cobbles and
sleepers with our golf carts for about
five kilometres and then realized this
was ridiculous idea we're walking
through a field farmer's field really
thick heavy mud and we came to a fence
me and Dave tried to lift the fence up
and pull our golf carts under both got
electrocuted and then nearly vomited so
when we were walking through so Lisa
Uruguayan coastal town what we thought
was a stray dog began following us and
the absolutely stunk Pete named him
stinky Jefferson and it wasn't until
three days before we finished the walk
that we found out that actually
Jefferson wasn't a stray dog we got a
message from a guy called nacho
Uruguayan guy whose friend had spotted
Jefferson in a local newspaper we told
nacho our plan to finish the walk at
least a bo bo in porto alegre and we
reunited them and it was a very
emotional and I think Walt Disney could
have written a more perfect end to the
story
it was definitely a journey that's
taught me a lot about myself and
resilient
you
